title: Al Hilal SFC - Wikipedia
snippet: Al-Hilal Saudi Football Club (Arabic: نادي الهلال السعودي), simply known as Al-Hilal, is a professional multi-sports club based in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. Their football team competes in the Saudi Pro League. In Arabic, Al-Hilal means "the Crescent Moon".

title: Al-Hilal United FC - Wikipedia
snippet: Al-Hilal United FC was founded in 2019 in Al Lisaili, Dubai, United Arab Emirates, and around February 2020, it was announced that Abdullah bin Musa'ad bin Abdulaziz Al Saud has ownership to the newly established club.

title: Saudi Arabia's PIF takes over Al-Ittihad, Al-Nassr, Al-Hilal and Al-Ahli - BBC Sport
snippet: Al-Ittihad, Al-Nassr and Al-Hilal - the top three in this season's top flight - plus second-tier champions Al-Ahli - have all come under the control of the PIF, which also owns Newcastle United.

title: Al-Hilal SFC - Facts and data | Transfermarkt
snippet: Al-Hilal Saudi Football Club (نادي الهلال السعودي) is a professional multi-sports club based in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.

title: Who owns Al-Hilal and which players have they signed so far? | Football | Metro News
snippet: Al Hilal is under shared ownership, with the Public Investment Fund (PIF) the majority owner with a 75% share.
